full_text:
Preparing for a Guidewire Exam

Lesson
objectives . Closed:-book/Proctored exams |

+ Describe how to prepare for a Guidewire proctored exam
+ Set expectations for the proctored exam experience

« Open-book exams
+ Describe how to prepare for a Guidewire open-book exam
+ Set expectations for the open-book exam experience

+ Identify resources available for use during open-book
exams

« Knowledge Checks
+ Describe how to prepare for a Guidewire Knowledge Check

+ Set expectations for the Knowledge Check experience

Proctored Exams

Which exams are closed-book/proctored? Gi
(1 of 2)

¢ Developer Exams
* InsuranceSuite Best Practices - EXAM
* Professional Certification — BillingCenter Configuration — Proctored Exam
« Professional Certification — ClaimCenter Configuration — Proctored Exam
¢ Professional Certification — PolicyCenter Configuration — Proctored Exam

* Professional Certification — InsuranceSuite Integration — Proctored Exam

See Developer Certification Paths in the Certification Options section of http://education.guidewire.com

Which exams are closed-book/proctored? Gi
(2 of 2)

¢ Analyst Exams
« Associate Certification — InsuranceSuite Analyst — Proctored Exam
* Professional Certification — PolicyCenter Business Analyst — Proctored Exam
¢ Professional Certification — BillingCenter Business Analyst — Proctored Exam

¢ Professional Certification — ClaimCenter Business Analyst — Proctored Exam

See Analyst Certification Paths in the Certification Options section of http:/education.quidewire.com

| How you should prepare for a closed-book/ Gi
proctored exam?

* Complete all the lessons in the relevant courses:
* Course content
+ Demonstrations

+ Hands-on lab exercises

¢ Enroll in the exam with your training coordinator or with edadmin@guidewire.com

+ Look for “Enrollment Confirmation” email from edadmin@guidewire.com
« Schedule to take the exam with our proctoring partner in advance

¢ Identify a test-taking space that complies with test-taking requirements

See the Proctored Exam Guide in the Certification Options section of http:/education.quidewire.com

| What you should expect during the closed-book/ Gi
proctored exam?
¢ The exam will consist of multiple-choice questions.
¢ The questions are meant to determine your ability to apply your knowledge.

* The exam will be proctored online by our proctoring partner using your webcam
and audio (no headphones allowed).

« Examinees will be asked to show identification.
*« The exam must be completed within 3 hours from the start, in one sitting.

« The proctored exam should take approximately 2-3 hours to complete.

Open-book Exams

| Which InsuranceSuite exams are open-book? Fi

Certification Prerequisite — InsuranceSuite Fundamentals — EXAM
Specialist Certification — BillingCenter Configuration - EXAM
Specialist Certification — ClaimCenter Configuration - EXAM
Specialist Certification — PolicyCenter Configuration - EXAM
Specialist Certification — InsuranceSuite Integration - EXAM
Specialist Certification - DataHub Integration - EXAM

Specialist Certification — InfoCenter Configuration - EXAM
Specialist Certification — InfoCenter Integration - EXAM

Specialist Certification — Digital Configuration - EXAM

See Developer Certification Paths in the Certification Options section of http://education.quidewire.com

| How you should prepare for an open-book exam? =-&i

* Complete all the lessons in the courses required for the exam:

Course content
Demonstrations
Hands-on lab exercises

¢ Familiarize yourself with supporting materials (available from your project team):

.

Guidewire product documentation (available on Guidewire Community
http://community.guidewire.com)

Guidewire products and Guidewire Studio (available from your IT team)
Product data dictionaries and security dictionary (available from your IT team)
PCF References (available in your product installation)

Gosu API Reference (available in your product installation)

Review the Exam Considerations Section of InsuranceSuite Certification Paths for Developers on
http://education.quidewire.com for your exam

| What to expect during an open-book exam Gi

¢ The exam will consist of 40-50 multiple-choice questions.

* Questions may require use of the open-book materials to successfully select the
correct answer or answers.

* On average, learners spend 6 to 8 hours completing the exam.

* Once they begin, learners have 24 hours to complete an open-book Specialist or
Fundamentals exam.

« Learners are allowed to pause and restart their open-book exam multiple times
within their 24-hour exam window.

| Resources you can use during an open-book exam [i

* Guidewire course content (available on http://education.quidewire.com)

* Simulations in most Guidewire lessons
* Student Workbooks in each Guidewire course
¢ Guidewire product documentation (available on Guidewire Community)
¢ Guidewire products and Guidewire Studio (available from your IT team)
« Product data dictionaries and security dictionary (available from your IT team)
« PCF References (available in your product installation)

* Gosu API Reference (available in your product installation)

Knowledge Checks

| Which exams are Knowledge Checks?

¢ New Features Courses

¢« SurePath Overview

| How you should prepare for a Knowledge Check

* Knowledge Checks test your knowledge of a lesson or a course.
* Knowledge Checks are like small quizzes.
* Complete the lessons in the relevant course:

* Course content

* Demonstrations

« Hands-on lab exercises

| What to expect during the Knowledge Check Gi

¢« Knowledge Checks will consist of 5-20 multiple-choice questions.

* Questions may be answered using the content from the lesson (open-book).

¢ Learners, on average, spend 10 to 30 minutes to complete the knowledge check.
* You must pass the Knowledge Check to complete the lesson or the course.

* You can retake the Knowledge Check as many times as you like.

Lesson
obj ectives « Closed-book/Proctored exams
review + Describe how to prepare for a Guidewire proctored exam

+ Set expectations for the proctored exam experience

« Open-book exams
+ Describe how to prepare for a Guidewire open-book exam
+ Set expectations for the open-book exam experience

+ Identify resources available for use during open-book
exams

« Knowledge Checks
+ Describe how to prepare for a Guidewire Knowledge Check

+ Set expectations for the Knowledge Check experience
